alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 12 at 8:59AM PST until January 14 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Eureka CA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Southeastern Mendocino Interior zone. For the Russian River...including Hopland...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. A peak stage of about 18 feet is forecast for the Russian River at Hopland. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 222 near Ukiah. Secondary roads in low-lying areas will be flooded in the Hopland, Ukiah, and Talmage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PST Friday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow afternoon as soon as 2 PM local time. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM PST.
